Issues.Title: "Too long with no output" error in integration_test job
Issues.Body:
The "integration_test" job seems to fail consistently in the "run_tests" step with a "Too long with no output" error:

See https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular/194384

Debugged a bit with SSH and looks like the yarn install is hanging when it starts running the bazel  integration test:

```
#################################
Running integration test bazel
#################################
yarn install v1.13.0
[1/4] Resolving packages...
[2/4] Fetching packages...
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ""Too long with no output" error in integration_test job" (#28611)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): remove nested placeholders with i18n
Issues.Body: While testing that queries where unaffected by i18n translation that removed placeholders, I noticed that we actually forgot to remove nested placeholders because the logic to check for removed placeholders was wrong. We were using `previousOrParentTNode` to get the last created node, but it turns out that when you call `elementEnd`, `previousOrParentTNode` becomes the parent of the current node, and we would stop our check at the wrong index (index of the parent instead of the index of the last node).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): remove nested placeholders with i18n" (#28595)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): support web worker nodes in unknown property checks
Issues.Body:
We need to support rendering in contexts like web workers where
nodes are emulated and properties may not be set directly. This
commit gates property validation checks to environments that have
real Node objects.

FW-1043 #resolve
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): support web worker nodes in unknown property checks" (#28610)

Issues.Title: test(ivy): turn on passing test in platform-browser
Issues.Body:
The behavior tested here was fixed by #28537, but I missed updating
the test in the original PR. This commit turns on the test to run
in Ivy mode, using "onlyInIvy" because the timing of the error message
is slightly different and requires CD to run.

Issues.Title: feat(router): add hash-based navigation option to setUpLocationSync
Issues.Body:
The `setUpLocationSync` function in @angular/router/upgrade didn't previously let you sync hash-based navigations. With this change, you can now pass an option to `setUpLocationSync` that will make sure location changes run in Angular in hash-based apps.

Fixes #24429 #21995

Issues.Title: ci: Global approvers list in CODEOWNERS doesn't seem to work
Issues.Body: We have a "@angular/framework-global-approvers" group in the [CODEOWNERS file](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/.github/CODEOWNERS#L81). This group of people should be able to approve PRs even if they are not a part of the specific sub-group(s) that own the files in the PR.  Currently, this doesn't work. If a person in the global approval group approves a PR, it still requests approval from any other sub-group that that person is not directly a part of.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ci: Global approvers list in CODEOWNERS doesn't seem to work" (#28601)

Issues.Title: Autocomplete through the `FormGroup` class
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!--Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request?-->
This feature request is for **@angular/forms**.


### Description
The ability to have an autocomplete using the `FormGroup` class with a type parameter.

So, instead of writing this:

```ts
contactUs: new FormGroup({ ... });
```

We'd be able to write this:

```ts
contactUs: new FormGroup<ContactUs>({ ... });
```

`ContactUs` would be a class, an interface or a type which would help with the autocomplete and the easier usage. For example, in my case, `ContactUs` is an interface:

```ts
interface ContactUs {
    name: FormControl;
    email: FormControl;
    message: FormControl;
}
```

### Describe the solution you'd like
I digged into the `~\angular\node_modules\@angular\forms\src\model.d.ts` file, moved to the `FormGroup` type class declaration.

That's how the `model.d.ts` file looked before:
![Default type definition](https://i.imgur.com/VRnpeWM.png)

First, I changed the `constructor` first parameter's type from:
```ts
[key: string]: AbstractControl;` to `[P in keyof T]: AbstractControl;`
```

Then, changed the class to a generic. From `FormGroup` to `FormGroup<T>`.
![Updated type definition](https://i.imgur.com/uDv8PDS.png)

We've got two another issues:

> Generic type 'FormGroup<T>' requires 1 type argument(s). ts(2314) [101, 22]
> Generic type 'FormGroup<T>' requires 1 type argument(s). ts(2314) [348, 23]

Changed the **101** line from:

```ts
readonly parent: FormGroup | FormArray;
```

To:

```ts
readonly parent: FormGroup<{ [key: string]: AbstractControl }> | FormArray;
```

And same with the line **348**.

Not sure if that's a perfect solution, but that's what I came to :) This way, I was able to get a perfect autocomplete based on the type I've provided in the type parameter:

![Autocomplete in action](https://i.imgur.com/VauRGHG.png)

`[key: string]` doesn't help a lot in this situation, updating the type definition would be very nice :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Autocomplete through the `FormGroup` class" (#28590)

Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router. ### Is this a regression? I don't know. ### Description My application component tree is the following : ``` AppComponent Level0Component* Level1Component Aux1 Aux2 Level2Component* Level3Component Aux3 Aux4 ``` Level0Component and Level2Component both have a secondary router outlet (outlet1 and outlet2). I'm able to activate Level1Component in the primary outlet of Level0Component and Aux1Component or Aux2Component in it's secondary outlet outlet1 by using this syntax : ``` L1-A1 L1-A2 ``` However I can't activate Level3Component in the primary outlet of Level2Component and Aux3Component or Aux4Component in it's secondary outlet outlet2 (while still activating Level1Component and Aux1Component or Aux2Component in Level0Component). Below is the syntax I'm using. I get an `Uncaught (in promise): Error: Cannot match any routes. URL Segment: 'level-0'` error when clicking those links. ``` L1-A1/L2/L3-A3 L1-A1/L2/L3-A4 ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/fork/angular-nested-auxiliary-routes The problem can be reproduced by clicking the `L1-A1/L2/L3-A3` and `L1-A1/L2/L3-A4` links. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: feat(bazel): add dts bundler as action to ng_module
Issues.Body:
feat(bazel): add dts bundler as action to ng_module

This enabled dts flattening in the final distributable package.

Notes:
 - For the time being this is an opt-in feature via the `ng_module` attribute  `bundle_dts`, however in the near future this will be turned on by default.
 - This only supports the legacy compiler `ngc`, as `ngtsc` emits namespaced imports `import * as __` from local modules which is not supported for the time being by API Extractor. See: https://github.com/Microsoft/web-build-tools/issues/1029

Ref: TOOL-611
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(bazel): add dts bundler as action to ng_module" (#28588)

Issues.Title: Angular-Flask issue for Uploading file through api call
Issues.Body:
üõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõëüõë

Please help us process issues more efficiently by filing an
issue using one of the following templates:

https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/new/choose

Thank you!
Hi team,
For my project, I am using Flask at server side and Angular at the client side. When I call a flask API to upload a CSV file then sometimes the file gets uploaded successfully and sometimes it throws the keyError on the file name.
I am continuously facing this issue and have tried various methods to handle the header while calling the API, but no luck in that. 
I have contacted the Flask community for the same but they are saying that it's some bug in the client-side. 
This is something to do with the form data being sent from the client side (angular) to server side and not getting passed correctly

I have tried using **headers: {'Content-Type': 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded'})**

The client-side is showing some CORS-POLICY error. 
And the funny part is that this error is coming sometimes and sometimes the file gets uploaded successfully.
[full_traceback.txt](https://github.com/angular/angular/files/2839989/full_traceback.txt)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/cli@7.3.0


### Is this a regression?
 The differential polyfills are not generating.


### Description

I have project created using @angular/cli 7.2.0 and I have updated to @angular/cli@7.3.0 to take advantage of differential polyfill's feature but it doesn't seems to be building that.

If we create a project in 7.3.0 and run the build, it will generate the differential polyfill's.  

Image speaks everything. Also please see the conversion with @mgechev [twitter](https://twitter.com/mgechev/status/1093357741068869632) 

There is one missing property `es5BrowserSupport : true` in the project generated `7.2.0` compare to `7.3.0`. Adding that property manually throws error (see attached image).

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1906881/52391623-f786c400-2a52-11e9-8d34-a25cf4c504e4.png)

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
When setting "es5BrowserSupport": true in angular.json I get errors in IE 11 because it does not recognize .includes()
`TypeError: Object doesn't support property or method 'includes'`

This issue below gave the original workaround, perhaps now that it is in a conditional polyfill we can add it by default.
https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/4128

### Describe the solution you'd like
Add the following polyfill to the Conditional ES5 Browser Polyfill so that .includes() works with IE 11
`import 'core-js/es7/array';`


### Describe alternatives you've considered
I can keep `import 'core-js/es7/array';` in the main polyfill file, but it is not needed by other browsers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "es5BrowserSupport add additional polyfill" (#13622)

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/cli@7.3.0


### Is this a regression?
 The differential polyfills are not generating.


### Description

I have project created using @angular/cli 7.2.0 and I have updated to @angular/cli@7.3.0 to take advantage of differential polyfill's feature but it doesn't seems to be building that.

If we create a project in 7.3.0 and run the build, it will generate the differential polyfill's.

Issues.Title: fix(@schematics/angular): use correct file extension for SASS (.scss)
Issues.Body:
The ng new command sets the incorrect file extension for SASS files in the angular.json. The configuration expects styles.sass, whereas it should be styles.scss. This is due to the fact that the pull request that dropped support for creating new angular applicaplications with the .sass extension (#13444) conflicted with the pull request to only support known style extensions (#13470).

This pull request changes the referenced extension for the sass language to the correct '.scss' ending.

closes #13574
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@schematics/angular): use correct file extension for SASS (.scss)" (#13602)

Issues.Title: [DragDropModule] Getting css Style of Elements
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
Current [DragDropModule](https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/overview) does offer nice dragging effects but I can't find a way to export css styling that the module has changed over dragging. 

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
The reason to export this is to get information about the previous drag so that event browser hits refreshing, user can still have their current dragging based on data saved in server side

#### Is there anything else we should know?
[DrapDrop Service](https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/api) offers create drag element when app is running. It's recommended to have a method inside this Service to export css value changed.

Issues.Title: LiveAnnouncer should have a global duration to remove the text
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
1. set a global duration, 
2. LiveAnnouncer.annouce(text)
3. the text is removed from DOM after global duration.


#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
When I open a MatDialog, I use screen reader(Voice Over) VO plus left arrow to do linear navigation. When I come to the beginning of dialog, I shouldn't be able to navigate to anywhere. However, I navigated to the DOM for LiveAnnouncer if LiveAnnoucer is used once.

I can use announce(text, duration) to work around this. This requires a duration for every announce call.


#### Is there anything else we should know?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "LiveAnnouncer should have a global duration to remove the text " (#15121)

Issues.Title: Allow CSS variables in color paletts
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.
A color pallet has to be defined by by using COLOR values, but doesn't allow CSS variables. 

Example:
````
$sample-pallet: (
  50 : var(--color-primary), ...
````
is invalid.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?
We have a application, where we defined the colors as CSS variables, so we can switch for  different brandings.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Only two places are depending on the colors:

```
  .mat-calendar-body-disabled > .mat-calendar-body-selected {
    background-color: fade-out(mat-color($palette), $mat-datepicker-selected-fade-amount);
  }
```
_theming.scss 2542

```
.mat-calendar-body-disabled > .mat-calendar-body-today:not(.mat-calendar-body-selected) {
    border-color: fade-out(mat-color($foreground, hint-text), $mat-datepicker-today-fade-amount);
  }
```
_theming.scss 2603

If these lines are commented out, a `pallet` can be used with `CSS variables`. 

I know CSS variables are not supported by Internet explorer. However just changing these two lines (the calendar disables state), would allow their usage!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow CSS variables in color paletts" (#15107)

Issues.Title: Mat-select with detached View
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?

That mat-select would work correctly after detaching the ComponentRef (`_cdRef. detach()`).

#### What is the current behavior?

It doesn't show any options. Moreover the click event doesn't seem to trigger anything. It is only after another `_cdRef. detach()` that the options popup will appear. Also, the native select does work correctly.

I'm not really sure if this is the expected behaviour and I have to work around it. 

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
Reproduction in StackBlitz
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-jrag5m


#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?

Angular CLI 7.2.2, Angular Material 7.2.0

cdk focus classes being added to the element.

**Current behaviour** 

Both latest (unsure about previous versions) stable Firefox and Safari seem to ignore mouse focus on an element that is monitored by FocusMonitor. Works in Chrome/Chromium. Did not test in IE/Edge.

Nested mat-nav-lists should not have have duplicate role="navigation".

#### What is the current behavior?
Currently if you nest lists you get multiple landmark regions of navigation for one list.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-dyyctn  

![nested-lists-extra-role](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10760551/52308427-e6f72080-2962-11e9-905e-fa143d8fbc28.png)  
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10760551/52308477-0a21d000-2963-11e9-89ae-2ef101d6bab0.png)  

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
7.3.1

#### Is there anything else we should know?
It's unclear from documentation if you support nested lists.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bug: Nested lists cause duplicated landmark roles" (#15096)

Issues.Title: Support derived material elements?
Issues.Body:
#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
I would like to extend MatTooltip to support additional styling and an optional error message.

![tooltip3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4026030/52346802-6b42b580-29ee-11e9-894e-b1576fdb3e6e.gif)

#### Is there anything else we should know?
The Material elements make copious use of `private` which effectively renders them final.  Would the team be opposed to a PR making some more pliable with `protected`?  In my use-case I require a minor change to the constructor and `show`, but that requires the private `_createOverlay` which in turns ripples into almost a full code copy.  I'd love to leverage the existing maintenance and knowledge base of the core project.  Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support derived material elements?" (#15100)

Issues.Title: build: branch manager should use "7.3.x" as patch branch
Issues.Body:
Updates the branch manager to validate patch PRs against the `7.3.x` branch. This is necessary because currently some PRs are marked as failing because they no longer apply to the outdated `7.2.x` branch.

cc. @josephperrott should we somehow add this to the release instructions? or should the branch manager automatically pick up the proper branch somehow (e.g. by checking the "package.json")
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: branch manager should use "7.3.x" as patch branch" (#15097)

Issues.Title: Can't save local date with datepicker.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Can't save local date with datepicker." (#15104)

Issues.Title: refactor(drag-drop): don't clone items array inside withItems
Issues.Body:
Currently when the consumer passes in an array of items to `withItems`, we clone the array which means that the indices won't update if the consumer shuffles them around. The original rationale behind it was to avoid accidentally mutating the array, however this makes it less convenient to use since the consumer would have to remember to move the item in the array __and__ call `withItems` in order to keep everything in sync when an item is dropped.

These changes remove the cloning and use `ReadonlyArray` to prevent us from accidentally making changes.

Fixes #15089.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(drag-drop): don't clone items array inside withItems" (#15103)

Issues.Title: mat-checkbox: Element matching '[cdkFocusInitial]' is not focusable.
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
Hi, I have a `<mat-checkbox >` that I'd like to autofocus inside a dialog. For this I'm using `<mat-checkbox cdkFocusInitial ...>`

#### What is the current behavior?
mat-checkbox does not receive focus, and the console contains a warning "Element matching '[cdkFocusInitial]' is not focusable."

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-vmf92a 

For some reason the stackblitz does not log the error to console, it only silently fails to set the initial focus.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.2.3, Material 7.3.1, MacOS Mojave, ts 3.2.4, chrome.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
Keep up the good work!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "mat-checkbox: Element matching '[cdkFocusInitial]' is not focusable." (#15098)
